summary: This document is a chain of emails from 2021 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), FBI agents, an NYPD detective, and a contractor, coordinating tasks related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails discuss obtaining evidence files, including .avi files from CART, reviewing images, drafting FBI interview reports (302s), and identifying Palm Beach Police Department witnesses to authenticate evidence seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence.

persons.name: Will
persons.context: A contractor for the U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) coordinating the receipt and transfer of evidence files related to the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the investigation and preparation tasks referenced throughout the email chain (e.g., 'Maxwell To-dos').

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned indirectly as the owner of the Palm Beach residence from which evidence was seized.

persons.name: Banasiak
persons.context: Listed as having living quarters that were searched at Epstein's Palm Beach residence.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial task list email from the Southern District of New York, coordinating evidence review and witness authentication for the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Palm Beach PD Captain
persons.context: Identified by Detective M as the point of contact for a task related to authenticating evidence from Epstein's Palm Beach residence.

connections.description: The AUSA directs tasks to and coordinates with contractor Will regarding evidence for the Maxwell case.
FBI Special Agent S coordinates directly with contractor Will to hand over files from CART.
NYPD Detective M provides updates on evidence processing (.avi files, photos) in response to inquiries from the AUSA.
Both are part of the law enforcement effort on the case, with M updating S and others on task progress.
Maxwell's case tasks are directly related to evidence from Epstein's Palm Beach residence, indicating their prior association.

events.title: Interviews of a witness
events.description: Interviews were conducted on January 20 and 21, 2021, with a witness (name redacted). The AUSA requests draft FBI 302 reports from these interviews.

events.title: Evidence Status Update
events.description: Detective M provides a comprehensive update on several evidentiary tasks: 302s have been sent, photos are under review, .avi files are being processed, and a Palm Beach PD Captain is identified as the point of contact.

events.title: File Handover Coordination
events.description: FBI Special Agent S and contractor Will coordinate the physical handover of files from CART.

locations: I St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively working in 2021 to authenticate physical evidence seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence, including message pads, for use in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The evidence review included specific .avi files from CART (likely court audio/video recordings) and a review of images for a specific, redacted purpose.
The email chain identifies several Palm Beach Police Department personnel by name who were involved in the 2005-2006 search of Epstein's home, indicating an effort to secure their testimony.
An NYPD detective assigned to a joint FBI task force was managing the processing of key digital evidence (.avi files, photos) for the prosecution.
The correspondence shows detailed coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office, FBI agents, an NYPD detective, and a contractor in the months leading up to Maxwell's trial.
